security: Disclosing the identities of informants and local detectives, as well as their methods of gathering information (e.g., using contacts in Paris), could compromise their safety and future intelligence operations. The report explicitly states it contains "SECURITY INFORMATION" and is marked "CONFIDENTIAL."
summary: A report from Bogota details information obtained from a local detective regarding delegates from Guatemala, Venezuela, Ecuador, and Cuba to the III Festival Mundial de la Juventud in Berlin in August-September 1961, as reported by an informant in Paris.
summary_one_paragraph: This confidential report, originating from Bogota in January 1962, relays information gathered by a local detective concerning delegates attending the III Festival Mundial de la Juventud held in Berlin during August and September 1961. The detective's source, an informant in Paris, provided names and commentary on delegates from Guatemala (Edelberto Torres Rivas, Octavio Reyes Ortiz, Hugo Barrios Klee, José Victor Gonzalez), Venezuela (Juvenel Herrera, Francisco Mierks, Cordova Armando, Nicolas Curiel Acosta, Juan Pedro Rojas, Yolanda Steffens de Rojas), Ecuador (Enrique Gil Gilbert, Enrique Quinibero, Patricia Cuevas), and Cuba (Nicolas Guillen, Santiago Grajales, Antonio Nunez-Jimenez, Francisco Garcia Benites, Jose Canetti). Noteworthy is the informant's assessment of certain individuals as 'peligroso' (dangerous), particularly Antonio Nunez-Jimenez from the Cuban delegation.
title: Delegates to Youth Festival in Berlin
recipient: Washington, Caracas, Guatemala City, Havana, Quito, Maracaibo, Guayaquil
